value.name: Family of Johnny Bolton, Cobb man killed by police in no-knock raid, demand answers
value.description: About six months after an Austell man, Johnny Bolton, was killed by police in a no-knock drug raid, Bolton’s family is demanding answers from law enforcement about what happened.

value.name: Cobb County Family Of Unarmed Black Man Demand Answers In Police Shooting
value.description: Johnny Bolton’s family is demanding answers for why he was killed by Cobb County Sheriff’s Office SWAT team during no-knock warrant execution in December 2020.

video.name: #JusticeForJohnnyBolton: Family Of Atlanta-Area Black Man Killed During No-Knock Warrant Demands Answers

value.name: Months After Georgia Man Was Shot By Police, Family Wants Answers
value.description: More than five months after a man was shot to death in an apartment outside Atlanta by officers serving a warrant targeting someone else, his family wants to know what happened, their lawyer says. Johnny Bolton,

value.name: Family, Attorneys Demand Justice In Johnny Bolton No-Knock Warrant Death
value.description: Five months after a Cobb County SWAT team killed Johnny Bolton, 49, and on the anniversary of George Floyd’s death, Bolton’s family spoke for the first time, saying they’ve heard nothing but silence from the Cobb County Sheriff's Office.

value.name: 'We want answers' | Family of man killed in Cobb County no-knock warrant speaks out for first time
value.description: The family of Johnny Bolton still does not have any information about the raid or who fired the shots that killed Bolton.

video.name: Family of man killed in Cobb County no-knock warrant speaks for first time

value.name: ‘We want answers’: Family says unarmed Cobb man killed during no-knock warrant incident
value.description: Johnny Lorenzo Bolton hadn’t had the chance to meet his only granddaughter. He planned to celebrate with little Kaliyah on her first birthday in February.

value.name: Family of Johnny Bolton, killed during a no-knock warrant search last year in Cobb Co., to speak
value.description: They are speaking for the first time today since his death in December.

value.name: City Of Tucker Holds William "Bill" Rosenfeld Park Dedication
value.description: Tucker City Councilman Bill Rosenfeld dedicated his life to serving others, and the city held a special park dedication on May 28, 2021, honoring his legacy.

value.name: 3 shot as dispute turns to gunfire in southeast Atlanta, police say
value.description: Three people were shot early Monday morning after Atlanta Police say a dispute led to gunfire. It happened in southeast Atlanta off Moury Avenue just before 12:30 a.m., police said. Two men and a woman were injured and transported to the hospital.
